predictions.text: If a U.S. federal government shutdown began on 2025-10-01, it will end by 2025-10-14 (inclusive) via enactment of a continuing resolution or full-year appropriations.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verification occurs if a bill ending the appropriations lapse is signed into law by 2025-10-14, evidenced by a Public Law on Congress.gov or a WhiteHouse.gov signing statement; OMB issues guidance ending the lapse.
evidence: Shutdown halts key federal data like the jobs report; pressure to resolve quickly.
Markets and agencies face rising costs as delays mount, historically catalyzing short CRs.
https://www.marketwatch.com/story/no-jobs-report-on-friday-but-that-may-not-be-the-worst-data-delay-due-to-federal-shutdown-e43e09bc?mod=mw_rss_topstories
monitoring_signals: House/Senate floor schedules and CR text filings
Leadership statements (Speaker, Senate Majority Leader, White House)
OMB Lapse in Appropriations status memos
predictions.rationale: Political and market costs of a prolonged data blackout raise odds of a short CR within two weeks.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, at least three U.S. state attorneys general will file lawsuits seeking to block distribution or use of newly approved generic mifepristone.
predictions.verification_criteria: Count state-AG-led or co-led suits filed in state or federal courts by 2025-10-31 that seek TROs/preliminary injunctions to halt distribution/use of generic mifepristone; verify via AG press releases and court dockets.
evidence: FDA approves generic mifepristone, intensifying state-level legal battles.
Recent precedent of coordinated multistate litigation over abortion pill access.
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/02/health/abortion-pill-generic-fda.html
monitoring_signals: State AG press rooms (TX, LA, MS, ID, AL, etc.)
PACER/state court docket trackers for mifepristone cases
Manufacturer/NGO statements on anticipated litigation
predictions.rationale: Generic approval expands access and lowers cost, likely triggering rapid multistate litigation in restrictive jurisdictions.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-10, Mexico’s Secretariat of Foreign Affairs (SRE) will issue a formal public statement or diplomatic note rejecting U.S. ‘war on cartels’ framing or potential cross-border military actions.
predictions.verification_criteria: An official SRE statement/diplomatic note posted on gob.mx/sre or SRE’s verified social accounts, or a press readout quoting SRE repudiating the U.S. characterization or potential military action.
evidence: U.S. declares a ‘war’ posture toward drug cartels, raising cross-border tensions.
Mexico historically rebuts perceived U.S. extraterritorial military assertions.
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/02/us/politics/trump-drug-cartels-war.html
monitoring_signals: SRE press releases and social media
Statements from Mexico’s Presidency and Defense Secretariat
U.S. White House/DoD clarifications on authorities
predictions.rationale: Mexico typically defends sovereignty promptly when U.S. rhetoric implies unilateral cross-border force.

predictions.text: From 2025-10-02 close to 2025-10-31 close, iShares Global Clean Energy ETF (ICLN) will underperform SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) by at least 4.0 percentage points based on percentage change in adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compute percent change in adjusted close between 2025-10-02 and 2025-10-31 for ICLN and SPY (Yahoo Finance). ICLN underperformance >= 4.0 percentage points satisfies.
evidence: DOE cancels $7.5B clean-energy projects during shutdown, raising policy risk.
Clean energy equities are rate-sensitive; uncertainty amplifies risk premia.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/02/energy-department-cancels-green-projects-in-united-states.html
monitoring_signals: DOE announcements on cancellations/deferrals
UST 10Y yield and real yields (DFII10)
ICLN fund flows and component guidance
predictions.rationale: Policy and rate headwinds likely push clean energy to lag broad equities near term.

predictions.text: Intel (INTC) will close at or above $50.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Any daily close for INTC shown at or above $50.00 on Yahoo Finance or Nasdaq.com by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
evidence: Intel shares jumped sharply; policy tailwinds and foundry narrative re-rating.
Broader AI capex cycle supports compute suppliers’ multiples.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/02/intel-stock-us-trump-stake.html
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/02/openai-share-sale-500-billion-valuation.html
monitoring_signals: IFS customer announcements and subsidies/CHIPS grants
Server/PC demand indicators and pricing
Short interest and options positioning
predictions.rationale: Momentum, policy support, and AI demand improve odds of testing higher price levels.

predictions.text: Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM) will underperform the PHLX Semiconductor Index (^SOX) by at least 3.0 percentage points from 2025-10-02 close to 2025-11-30 close.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare percent change in adjusted close for TSM vs ^SOX from 2025-10-02 to 2025-11-30 (Yahoo Finance). TSM minus ^SOX <= -3.0 percentage points satisfies.
evidence: Taiwan resists U.S. ‘50-50’ chip production push, adding policy uncertainty.
Index peers may benefit more directly from U.S. industrial policy flows.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/02/taiwan-us-chip-production-tsmc-trade-tariffs.html
monitoring_signals: US-Taiwan tariff/industrial policy negotiations
TSMC guidance, capex, and customer mix updates
Movements in SOX heavyweights (NVDA, AMD, AVGO)
predictions.rationale: Policy frictions and supply-chain geopolitics could weigh on TSM relative to peers.

predictions.text: MP Materials (MP) will close at or above $20.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Any daily close for MP shown at or above $20.00 on Yahoo Finance by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
evidence: U.S. policy momentum for domestic critical minerals and processing build-out.
Investor interest heightened by administration talks with producers.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/02/usa-rare-earth-lithium-americas-mp-materials-trump.html
monitoring_signals: DoD/DOE contract awards or loan guarantees
China export policy on rare earths
Commodity prices for NdPr and rare earth oxides
predictions.rationale: Policy catalysts and strategic importance can drive rerating despite commodity volatility.

predictions.text: NYMEX RBOB gasoline front-month futures (RB) will settle at or below $2.15 per gallon on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: CME settlement price for the front-month RB futures contract at or below $2.15/gal on any session by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Post-summer seasonal demand softness typically pressures gasoline cracks.
Macro uncertainty and easing refinery bottlenecks can weigh on RBOB.
monitoring_signals: EIA gasoline inventories and 4-week product supplied
Refinery utilization and crack spreads
WTI/Brent price trends and refinery outages
predictions.rationale: Seasonal demand fade and adequate inventories raise odds of a downside test.

predictions.text: USD/MXN (Yahoo Finance: MXN=X) will trade at or above 19.20 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Intraday high on Yahoo Finance for MXN=X (USD/MXN) reaches or exceeds 19.20 by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
evidence: Heightened U.S.-Mexico tensions over ‘war on cartels’ rhetoric may pressure MXN.
Risk-off shifts tend to lift USD broadly.
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/10/02/us/politics/trump-drug-cartels-war.html
monitoring_signals: DXY and U.S. real yields (DFII10)
Banxico communications and intervention signals
Headlines on cross-border security cooperation
predictions.rationale: Policy and geopolitical noise can weaken MXN episodically, pushing USD/MXN higher.
